Question.Question: 1: Routine ECG-monitored exercise test is ……….. sensitive ……. specific in women as it is in men.
2: ……………… increase(s) the risk of cardiovascular disease more in women than in men
3: ST-elevation myocardial infarction should be managed the same way in women as it is in men.
4: Compared to men, women who survive myocardial infarction have ……….. risk of further adverse cardiac events.
5: The risk of fatal coronary heart disease in women with diabetes is approximately ……………… when compared to their male counterparts.
6: Should a female patient stop smoking, her cardiovascular risk returns to that of a woman who had never smoked within ……………… .
7: Women with angina will often present with atypical chest pain that radiates into the throat and neck or back.

Article.Naam: Risk of cardiovascular disease in women

Question.Question: 1: Smoking cessation for 10 years and more decreases CVD morbidity and mortality to almost that of non-smokers.
2: Elevated LDL-c levels are more predictive of coronary risk in . . .
3: After the sixth decade of life women have lower systolic blood pressure (SBP) levels than men.
4: Women with an increased duration of oral contraceptive use are at an increased risk of hypertension.
5: In women, a BMI >30kg/m2 is associated with an increased risk of . . .
6: Both HDL-c and TG levels have greater predictive potential in women than men
